metadata.synopsis: Ulma, the leader of Gur Tribe, talks to Astarion-companion. Gur Hunter from Act 1, if he is alive, also present.Scene Trigger - WYR_GurCamp_Intro_SceneTrigger_8c9acc78-9d97-4d0f-919e-3997c015ed7f
metadata.how_to_trigger: Ctrl+Shift+7 (Origin Debug Book)Astarion - Recruit - As CompanionAstarion - Origin Moments - Gur CampApproach the Gur Camp

55.speaker: Ulma
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking onto a pyre, where a variety of possessions are being burned - armour and broken weapons, as well as clothing, NodeContext: REK tay ee HATH-ran ROOST

68.speaker: Gandrel
68.text: Welcome, friend. You've joined us as we honour our fallen dead - a sombre time.

23.speaker: Gandrel
23.text: And you have brought a sombre guest. I did not think you would willingly return, spawn.

78.speaker: Astarion
78.text: Well indeed. I was rather hoping I'd never see you people again, honestly.

63.speaker: Gandrel
63.text: My friend from the hag swamp? You join us as we honour our fallen dead - you are a bright light on a dark day.

18.speaker: Astarion
18.context: CinematicNodeContext: With a nervous little wave

34.speaker: Ulma
34.text: Frey vald isk durovna. Frey vald isk ablast.
34.context: NodeContext: FREY vald isk dur-OF-nah. FREY vald isk ab-LAST

3.speaker: Astarion
3.text: I feel we're intruding. We should leave. Quickly.

15.speaker: Gandrel
15.text: Calm yourself - you will not be harmed. Our leader has called off the hunt. She wishes to speak to you.

67.speaker: Ulma
67.text: Im orak ne tay. Krasin ne trah!
67.context: NodeContext: IM or-AK nay tay. KRAS-in nay TRAH

10.speaker: Ulma
10.text: Frey vald isk durovna. Frey vald isk ablast.
10.context: NodeContext: FREY vald isk dur-OF-nah. FREY vald isk ab-LAST

66.speaker: Narrator
66.text: *You recognise the funeral rites of the Gur people - the same monster hunters you met in the hag's swamp. Their leader is burning the possessions of those who have fallen.*

7.speaker: Narrator
7.text: *You recognise the funeral rites of the Gur people - a tribe of monster hunters. Their leader is burning the possessions of those who have fallen.*

47.speaker: Ulma
47.text: Im orak ne tay. Krasin ne trah!
47.context: NodeContext: IM or-AK nay tay. KRAS-in nay TRAH

77.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ulma pauses for a moment, staring at the fire in contemplation before she turns and walks over to the player.

61.speaker: Ulma
61.text: So, the impossible spawn walks among us in the blazing sun. We have been looking for you.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: What do you want with Astarion?

88.speaker: Ulma
88.text: The last time your friend came to our camp, he stole our children. Our future.

74.speaker: Gandrel
74.text: When I was hunting you, I was to bring you back here. To interrogate you, discover how to save our children, and then destroy you.

30.speaker: Ulma
30.text: When we sent Gandrel after you, we wanted to interrogate you. To discover how to save our children and then destroy you.

75.speaker: Ulma
75.text: But things have changed. You have changed.

13.speaker: Ulma
13.text: Is it true you left your master? That you broke the spell that binds you to him?

31.speaker: Astarion
31.text: Well, I mean... kind of? It's a long story, honestly.

28.speaker: Ulma
28.text: Free? Not while his master still lives. But he has, perhaps, earned a second chance.

26.speaker: Ulma
26.text: We have tried to save our children once already, attacking Cazador Szarr's palace at first light. Even then, it was too well defended.

64.speaker: Ulma
64.text: But if his own spawn approached? Someone he thought he could control? He would throw his doors open and welcome you in.

14.speaker: Ulma
14.text: And once inside, you could do what we could not. You could save the children you damned.

22.speaker: Astarion
22.text: You don't know Cazador like I do - he's merciless.

54.speaker: Astarion
54.text: You want me to march into the lion's den and save your children, but I promise you, they're already dead.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: We'll do it. We'll save them.

76.speaker: Astarion
76.text: Excuse me? Did you not hear anything I just said? They're gone.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: How can you be sure, Astarion?

48.speaker: Astarion
48.text: I spent two hundred years bringing him victims. Each and every one was whisked away to be fed on that night.

35.speaker: Ulma
35.text: But you never saw him feed yourself? He could keep prisoners for days before killing them.

4.speaker: Gandrel
4.text: I know our plight is grim, but if there is even a chance to save them, we must take it.

6.speaker: Ulma
6.text: If our children are truly gone, then we ask for blood. I know you can understand that, spawn.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: If Astarion won't help you, then I will.

27.speaker: Astarion
27.text: Gods damn it - fine! If nothing else, at least killing Cazador will feel good.

79.speaker: Ulma
79.text: Thank you, from me and all my people. If you can do this, we will be in your debt.

8.speaker: Ulma
8.text: You have lived a life of violence and sin. You have stolen lives, broken families, and caused immeasurable grief.  Doing this will not right those wrongs.

11.speaker: Astarion
11.text: If you're trying to encourage me, you're failing abysmally.

24.speaker: Ulma
24.text: But it will be a start. You may still be redeemed.

21.speaker: Ulma
21.text: Please, go. Time is short, but we will see you again when it is done.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: You owe them revenge, Astarion. If nothing else, you owe them that.

69.speaker: Astarion
69.text: I suppose... Yes. Yes, revenge I can do.
69.context: NodeContext: Weighing his options, slightly reluctant to concede, but he will

38.speaker: Player
38.text: We can't help you. There's nothing more to discuss.

36.speaker: Gandrel
36.text: I hoped to find at least one monster that could be redeemed, but it seems not.

71.speaker: Ulma
71.text: So you leave us no choice. You are too dangerous to walk this world, spawn. If you cannot be redeemed, then you must be destroyed.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: It was more dumb luck than any skill on his part.

70.speaker: Ulma
70.text: One is just as important as the other, I find. And our luck has been poor.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: What business is it of yours?

42.speaker: Ulma
42.text: For those your friend stole from us, it is a matter of life and death.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: I'm thinking of turning it into a ballad, if you're interested?

29.speaker: Ulma
29.text: We are not. But perhaps we can give you a chance to do deeds just as worthy of song.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: If you want to throw him on that pyre, I fully support that.

91.speaker: Ulma
91.text: I promise you, the thought did cross my mind.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: We want nothing to do with you.

0.speaker: Astarion
0.text: I have to admit, I don't love sitting down for a chat with people who've relentlessly hunted me.

84.speaker: Ulma
84.text: I am offering an olive branch. Do not knock it aside so quickly.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: You can take that olive branch and shove it.

57.speaker: Ulma
57.text: Then we have no use for you.

87.speaker: Ulma
87.text: You're monsters, all of you. Hunters, to me!

53.speaker: Narrator
53.text: *You've clearly walked into some kind of ceremony, but it's nothing that you recognise.*

65.speaker: Narrator
65.text: *You do recognise the language, however. These people are Gur, a tribe of monster hunters just like the one you met in the hag's swamp.*

51.speaker: Narrator
51.text: *You do recognise the language, however. These people are Gur, a tribe of monster hunters.*

39.speaker: Narrator
39.text: *She's speaking the language of the Gur people, one influenced by ancient Rashemi tongues. She's praying for the fallen of her tribe as their possessions are burned.*

9.speaker: Narrator
9.text: *You recognise the language of the Gur people, sprinkled with words from ancient Rashemi tongues, but you cannot follow what's being said.*

82.speaker: Ulma
82.text: What are you doing? You and the spawn should be at the palace, not here!

19.speaker: Astarion
19.text: You do not decide where I should be. Not now, not ever.

32.speaker: Astarion
32.text: And you - you've been making friends behind my back. What exactly have you signed us up to?
32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the playerInternalNodeContext: Looking at the playerNodeContext: Addressed to the player. Astarion's just finding out the player has made a deal with the Gur monster hunters.

25.speaker: Ulma
25.text: You pledged to help us. Have you so quickly gone back on your word?
25.context: InternalNodeContext: Met Ulma without Astarion before. Now you meet her with Astarion as your companion.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: No, of course not. We will go to Cazador's palace.

90.speaker: Ulma
90.text: Thank you, now please go. We have lost enough time already.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Astarion's refusing to help you. I thought you should know.

81.speaker: Astarion
81.text: What? You're handing me over to them?

5.speaker: Ulma
5.text: If we cannot have our children back, at least we will have justice.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: Well, of course. To hells with you!
